instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: 820 2533 - Backlight issue
threads.message:
Hey ,

Liquid damage, Area <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.. This one  already works but backlight appear slowly and with DIM backlight like photo show.  

Already replace <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>, <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>, <RESISTOR>R9840</RESISTOR>, fix trace <SIGNAL>PIN_24</SIGNAL> _U9701 to <SIGNAL>PIN1_C9796</SIGNAL>. 

LCD connector looks well and already did 3 PRAM. 

Any suggestion ? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 2533 - Backlight issue
threads.message:
"fix trace <SIGNAL>PIN_24</SIGNAL> _U9701 to <SIGNAL>PIN1_C9796</SIGNAL>."
Are you sure?
I hope you didn't do that...

threads.title: 820 2533 - Backlight issue
threads.message: Sorry, my mistake. i mean <SIGNAL>PIN_21_U9701</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PIN1_C9796</SIGNAL>. was corroded.

threads.title: 820 2533 - Backlight issue
threads.message:
Post voltage at pin 2 of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>.
<CAPACITOR>C9797</CAPACITOR>/99 are both OK?
Check all return resistors, R971x.

threads.title: 820 2533 - Backlight issue
threads.message:
pin 2 of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> = 28.90V 

Ya <CAPACITOR>C9797</CAPACITOR>/99 it's ok. no corrosion on there. 

i will check all resistors. but all seems ok. thanks
